intro: Nothaphoebe boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin mahogany, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurel and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
